intro: Hyoseris simplex, commonly known as the common yellow sunflower, is a flowering plant native to various regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its height can range from 30 to 120 centimeters, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hyoseris simplex is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other familiar flowering plants.
